project.name: Fairness-Aware Academic Search Engine
project.description: A search engine for academic papers that highlights author-declared diversity attributes and re-ranks results with fairness-aware scoring while maintaining transparency.
goals: Enable users to search academic papers with both keyword and semantic search.
Extract and highlight 'contribution' sentences from papers.
Tag authors based on authoritative, self-declared sources (e.g., ORCID, curated lists).
Provide a fairness-aware re-ranking that transparently boosts underrepresented authors.
Offer provenance, transparency, and ethical safeguards against misrepresentation.

features: Paper detail view (abstract, metadata, citations, contribution summary)
Toggle for boosted vs unboosted ranking view

data_indexing.pdf_handling: Store metadata + PDF links (only when allowed)
text_extraction_pipeline: Contribution extraction using NLP/LLM or rule-based keyword matching

principles: Only use self-declared or authoritative info (ORCID, personal sites, university bios).
Supplement with curated lists from trusted sources.

algorithm.tag_boost: beta (e.g., 0.25) if any author is in curated/self-declared list

transparency: Show badge + tooltip for boosted results
Provide toggle to view unboosted ranking

logging_feedback.moderation: Manual review of feedback and tag corrections

rules: No inference of race/gender from names or photos.
Every author tag must link to a source (provenance).
Do not store sensitive data without consent.
Respect API ToS (Crossref, ArXiv, Semantic Scholar).
bias_metrics: Track fraction of curated underrepresented authors in top-k results.
Measure precision@k and nDCG with and without re-ranking.

mvp: Ranking by relevance + citation count fallback.
Basic author tagging from ORCID + curated CSV.
Responsive UI with badges and provenance tooltips.
advanced: Semantic search using embeddings + vector DB.
Automated contribution summarization (LLM-assisted, with source links).
Exportable bibliographies and shareable search links.

nlp: Hugging Face Transformers for LLM tasks

action_plan.phase_1: Repo scaffold (GitHub, LICENSE, README, issue board)
action_plan.phase_2: Fetch demo dataset (200–500 papers from ArXiv, 2–3 topics)
action_plan.phase_3: Basic search API + React frontend (titles + abstracts)
action_plan.phase_8: Write-up: README ethics, demo video, screenshots
action_plan.phase_9_optional: Add embeddings, semantic search, and summarization

resume_highlights: Built fairness-aware academic search engine with transparent boosting.
Implemented ingestion pipeline from scholarly APIs.
Designed rule-based and AI-enhanced contribution extraction.
Developed re-ranking algorithm with provenance and transparency.

fairness_metrics: underrepresented authors in top-k before/after boost
evaluation.human_eval: Volunteers rate relevance and accuracy of contributions
evaluation.a_b_testing: Compare boosted vs unboosted user satisfaction

risks_tradeoffs.mislabeling: Mitigation: only authoritative/curated sources + dispute flow
risks_tradeoffs.relevance_vs_fairness: Keep boost small and test with users
